Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: * extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.75 * extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 * sketch\\_scale: 0.1347 * operation: Create a new solid body Part 1 measures 0.1347 units in length, 0.75 units in width, and 0.1347 units in height. Part 2 Instructions Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a cylindrical tube. The tube has a smaller diameter than the cylinders. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: 90.0, 0.0, -90.0 * Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.6422, 0.1257 For the sketch, draw three circles on face_1, face_2, and face_3 with the following coordinates: * Face 1: + Circle: Center Point (0.0, 0.0), Radius: 0.0022 * Face 2: + Circle: Center Point (0.2672, 0.0), Radius: 0.0022 * Face 3: + Circle: Center Point (0.5345, 0.0), Radius: 0.0022 Scale the sketch using the sketch\\_scale factor of 0.5344. Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: * extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.0 * extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 * sketch\\_scale: 0.5344 * operation: Join existing body Part 2 measures 4.491e-05 units in length, 0.5344 units in width, and 0.5344 units in height.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: A rectangular prism with a square hole in the center The first part is a rectangular prism with a square hole in the center. We will create a new coordinate system and then draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. Creating the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation and translation vectors. Drawing the 2D sketch 1. Draw a rectangle for the outer dimensions of the prism. The rectangle has four lines: - Line 1: Start point 0,0; End point 0.75,0 - Line 2: Start point 0.75,0; End point 0.75,0.5 - Line 3: Start point 0.75,0.5; End point 0,0.5 - Line 4: Start point 0,0.5; End point 0,0 2. Draw a smaller square inside the rectangle for the hole. The square has four lines: - Line 1: Start point 0.25,0.1875; End point 0.5,0.1875 - Line 2: Start point 0.5,0.1875; End point 0.5,0.3125 - Line 3: Start point 0.5,0.3125; End point 0.25,0.3125 - Line 4: Start point 0.25,0.3125; End point 0.25,0.1875 This results in one face for the outer prism and one face for the inner hole. Scaling the sketch Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 so that the outer dimensions of the prism match the specified length and width. Transforming the sketch into a 3D sketch Use the predefined Euler angles and translation vector to transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch. Extruding the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal direction to create a 3D solid model. The extrusion depth for both forward and reverse directions is specified as 0.0469 (height). Applying the operation With no prior CAD models to work with, the boolean operation for this part results in the creation of a new solid body.</description>
